dt: {bc}to convey indirectly and by {d_link|allusion|allusion} rather than explicitly

dt.t: a suspicion that she scarcely dared to {wi}hint{/wi}

dt: {bc}to give an indirect suggestion or piece of evidence that leads one toward the solution of a problem {bc}to give a hint

pt: {sc}suggest{/sc} {sc}imply{/sc} {sc}hint{/sc} {sc}intimate{/sc} {sc}insinuate{/sc} mean to convey an idea indirectly. {sc}suggest{/sc} may stress putting into the mind by association of ideas, awakening of a desire, or initiating a train of thought.

pt.t: a film title that {it}suggests{/it} its subject matter

pt: {sc}imply{/sc} is close to {sc}suggest{/sc} but may indicate a more definite or logical relation of the unexpressed idea to the expressed.
{sc}hint{/sc} implies the use of slight or remote suggestion with a minimum of overt statement.

pt.t: {it}hinted{/it} that she might get the job

pt: {sc}intimate{/sc} stresses delicacy of suggestion without connoting any lack of candor.

pt.t: {it}intimates{/it} that there is more to the situation than meets the eye

pt: {sc}insinuate{/sc} applies to the conveying of a usually unpleasant idea in a sly underhanded manner.

shortdef: to convey indirectly and by allusion rather than explicitly
to give an indirect suggestion or piece of evidence that leads one toward the solution of a problem : to give a hint —usually used with at

dt: {bc}to talk about (something) in an indirect way

dt.t: He's been {it}hinting at{/it} the possibility of running for mayor.
The history textbook only {it}hinted at{/it} the racial prejudice of that era.

shortdef: to talk about (something) in an indirect way

dt: {bc}to make a statement that suggests something that one does not want to say in a direct way

dt.t: He's been {it}dropping hints{/it} that he'd like to be invited to the party.

shortdef: to make a statement that suggests something that one does not want to say in a direct way

dt: {bc}to understand what someone is suggesting when he or she says something in an indirect way

dt.t: When she told me how much work she had to do, I {it}got/took the hint{/it} and left.

shortdef: to understand what someone is suggesting when he or she says something in an indirect way

dt: {bc}to understand what someone is suggesting when he or she says something in an indirect way

dt.t: "I have a lot of work to do." "OK, I'll leave. I can {it}take a hint{/it}."

shortdef: to understand what someone is suggesting when he or she says something in an indirect way
